intro: Jurinella subacaulis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved jurinella, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces showy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Jurinella subacaulis is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in open woodlands or along stream banks.
